data.title: The 101 Best Movies With Rain in the Title
data.meta_description: Over 100 filmgoers have voted on the 101 Best Movies With Rain in the Title. Current Top 3: Singin' in the Rain, Rain Man, Purple Rain
data.text:
Ranked By

541 votes

123 voters

How many movies with rain in the title can you name? This list ranks the best movies with rain in the name, whether they're documentaries, dramas, horror movies, or any other genre of film. Do you have a favorite movie with rain in the title? Categorizing movies by words in their titles is kind of uncommon, but that's a big part of why this list is so fun to scroll through. There's probably one movie with rain in the title you think of right away, but you might be shocked to see how many others exist as well.

Notable films with rain in the title include Rain Man, Singin' in the Rain, and Purple Rain, although there are many more examples on this list. This poll is interactive, meaning you can vote the rain movies up or down depending on how much you like them.

Most divisive: Black Rain

Over 100 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 101 Best Movies With Rain in the Title

A magnificent blend of music, comedy, and romance, this classic film showcases the Hollywood transition from silent movies to "talkies" with dazzling song-and-dance numbers. Gene Kelly, Debbie Reynolds, and Donald O'Connor bring heartfelt performances; their chemistry onstage is palpable. The iconic title sequence featuring Gene Kelly dancing through puddles with his umbrella will forever be etched in cinema history.

Released : 1952

Directed by : Stanley Donen, Gene Kelly

Dig Deeper Every Song in Singin' in the Rain, Ranked by Singability

Also ranks # 10 on Musical Movies With The Best Songs

Dustin Hoffman, Tom Cruise, Valeria Golino

A poignant portrayal of the bond between two estranged brothers, this heartwarming drama explores the challenges of autism. Dustin Hoffman's nuanced performance as an autistic savant earned him an Academy Award, while Tom Cruise's portrayal of a selfish and materialistic businessman brought depth to his character. The film continues to resonate with audiences, shedding light on the power of love and acceptance.

Released : 1988

Directed by : Barry Levinson

Dig Deeper Movies That Won Best Picture at the Oscars and Golden Globes

Also ranks # 56 on The Best Movies Of The 1980s, Ranked

Also ranks # 19 on The Very Best Oscar-Winning Movies For Best Picture

Prince, Apollonia Kotero, Morris Day

This cult classic fuses live footage of Prince and The Revolution with a fictionalized story of a young musician's struggle to balance love and artistic ambition. The Rock 'n' Roll tale features memorable performances from Apollonia Kotero, Morris Day, and Jerome Benton. Coupled with its electrifying soundtrack, the film remains an 80s phenomenon that impacted a generation.

Released : 1984

Directed by : Albert Magnoli

Also ranks # 190 on The Best Movies Of The 1980s, Ranked

Also ranks # 89 on Musical Movies With The Best Songs

Also ranks # 33 on The Best Movies Of 1984, Ranked

Eva Marie Saint, Don Murray, Anthony Franciosa

A gritty exploration of the human side of addiction, the film unveils the struggle of a young war veteran suffering from heroin dependency. Anthony Franciosa delivers a compelling performance as the tormented lead, while Eva Marie Saint provides strong support as his unsuspecting wife. The movie manages to maintain empathy for its complex protagonist without resorting to glamorization or sentimentality.

Released : 1957

Directed by : Fred Zinnemann

Morgan Freeman, Christian Slater, Randy Quaid

This tension-filled action thriller set in a flooded small town gives a new twist to the conventional heist film. Christian Slater and Morgan Freeman play the unlikely duo trying to outwit each other while avoiding the rising floodwaters and ruthless criminals. The flooded landscapes and relentless rainstorms contribute to the atmospheric and heart-pounding experience.

Released : 1998

Directed by : Mikael Salomon

Also ranks # 105 on The Best Disaster Movies Of All Time

Also ranks # 23 on The Best Movies About Stealing Money

Also ranks # 58 on The Best '90s Thriller Movies, Ranked

James Caan, Shirley Knight, Robert Duvall

A thought-provoking character study, the film follows a restless housewife who embarks on a cross-country road trip, forming unexpected relationships along the way. Shirley Knight's captivating portrayal of the central character is complemented by James Caan's performance as a brain-damaged football player. Their unusual bond challenges the viewer to question societal norms and expectations.

Released : 1969

Directed by : Francis Ford Coppola
